Class PalAudioOut_Samples

java.lang.Object
  PalAudioOut_Samples

public class PalAudioOut_Samples
extends java.lang.Object

Generates sound intensity values for a sine wave as a rom lookup table suitable for use in Handel-C projects that use PalAudioOut() macros.

This program generates 20-bit sample values for the sound intensities, but drops the necessary number of low-order bits to result in a table of values of bitsPerSample width.

The program may be instantiated from the command line, in which case the following command line options are available: 

        Option                  Default Value
    -r  Sampling Rate in Hz     48000.0
    -b  Bits per sample         20
    -f  Target Frequency in Hz  440.0
    -c  Minimum Cycles          1
    -d  Max Frequency Deviation 0.0 (no limit)

Generates enough sound samples for one complete sine wave cycle. However, the period of the generated wave only approximates the period of the desired wave unless the period of the desired wave is an exact multiple of the sampling period. Generated comment lines tell the target and effective frequency values.

Use the -c option to specify the minimum number of cycles to generate. The larger the value, the smaller the resulting frequency deviation.

Use the -d option to specify how small a deviation you want. The program will generate enough additional cycles, beyond the minimum, necessary to meet that requirement.

Here is a link for downloading the program: Generate_Audio_Samples.jar. You can run the program by double-clicking on the jar file, but you will not see any output unless you invoke it from the command line:

  java -jar Generate_Audio_Samples.jar <options …>

The output of the program is written to the console. The normal procedure is to redirect the output to a file to use as a Handel-C header file.

Author:
C. Vickery

Constructor Detail

PalAudioOut_Samples

public PalAudioOut_Samples()
Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Process command line arguments and then generate a list of signed integer values suitable for compilation by the Handel-C compiler. 
    Argument          Parameter                          (default)
    -f  [frequency]   Sine wave frequency in Hz.           (440.0)
    -r  [rate]        Sampling rate.                     (48000.0)
    -b  [bits]        Bits per Sample.                        (20)
    -c  [cycles]      Number of sound wave cycles to generate. (1)
    -d  [deviation]   Maximum deviation between generated and
                      nominal frequencies in Hz.             (0.0)

getDesiredFrequency

public double getDesiredFrequency()
Returns:
Sine wave frequency, in Hertz.

setDesiredFrequency

public void setDesiredFrequency(double desiredFrequency)
                         throws InvalidParameterException
Sets the frequency of the sine wave to generate, in Hertz. Default value is 440 Hz.

Parameters:
desiredFrequency - Sine wave frequency, in Hertz.
Throws:
InvalidFormatException - If desired Frequency is less than one.
InvalidParameterException

getBitsPerSample

public int getBitsPerSample()
Returns:
Width of generated samples, in bits.

setBitsPerSample

public void setBitsPerSample(int bitsPerSample)
                      throws InvalidParameterException
Sets the width of the generated samples, in bits. Must be between 1 and 20. Default value is 20 (the value for the RC200 audio out device).

Parameters:
bitsPerSample - The width of generated samples, in bits.
Throws:
InvalidParameterException - If bitsPerSample is not between 1 and 20.

getMaxDeviation

public double getMaxDeviation()
Returns:
The current setting for maxDeviation.

setMaxDeviation

public void setMaxDeviation(double maxDeviation)
Sets the tolerance for the deviation of the generated sine wave from the nominal value specified, in Hertz. Inaccuracies due to using a low sampling rate can be overcome by generating multiple cycles worth of samples. By setting this parameter to a positive value, the generator will produce as many cycles as needed to produce a frequency that is within maxDeviation of the targeted frequency. A negative value means this parameter is to be ignored. Default value is -1.0.

Parameters:
maxDeviation - The maximum allowable deviation of frequency of the generated samples from the nominal frequency requested, in Hertz. Does not need to be an integer.
Throws:
InvalidParameterException - If maxDeviation is less than 0.

getNumCycles

public int getNumCycles()
Returns:
Number of sine wave cycles to generate.

setNumCycles

public void setNumCycles(int numCycles)
                  throws InvalidParameterException
Sets the number of sine wave cycles to generate. Must be at least one, and might be larger. Default value is 1.

Parameters:
numCycles - The number of sine wave cycles to generate.
Throws:
InvalidParameterException - If the number of cycles is less than 1.

getSamplingRate

public double getSamplingRate()
Returns:
The sampling rate, in Hertz.

setSamplingRate

public void setSamplingRate(double samplingRate)
                     throws InvalidParameterException
Sets the sampling rate. Must not be less than one. Should be at least twice the sine wave frequency. Default value is 48 KHz.

Parameters:
samplingRate - The sampling rate to use, in Hertz.
Throws:
InvalidParameterException - If the sampling rate is less than one.
